data.title: Cute 'n Fun
data.text: Small museum that is very much boy fun and is a good quick thing to do. The place is small and could be a fun thing on days you don't have alot of kid time but know they deserve a break and something fun.

data.title: Nice Visit Back Into the Past
data.text:
The Daisy Airgun Museum sits on a corner in downtown Rogers.

When you see the display of Daisy BB guns and other products, you are transported back in time to your childhood. Old memories come to life as you stroll through the exhibits detailing the history of the company and the history of airgun use in America.

Everything is well designed and well done and well worth a visit.

J. Randolph Smith
Monroe, LA

data.title: Great place to visit
data.text:
Great history of the Daisy BB gun. Lots of displays that will bring back memories.
If you owned a bb gun as a kid this is a place for you to see and enjoy.
Very nice Museum and gift shop.

data.title: Excellent learning
data.text: I found this from TripAdvisor and wanted to go. After War Eagle Mill went to downtown Rogers to visit museum. Learning a lot about air guns. I never knew that Clark and Lewis has air gun. I thought it was black powder muzzle gun. See many different kinds of gun and how made and tools.

data.title: Childhood memories revisited
data.text: Excellent place for those of us that cherish the memories of childhood days long gone and the opportunity to revisit with my children.  Go and take your time, read and enjoy.

data.title: A must visit
data.text: We saw the sign for this and had to stop.  If you grew up with a BB-gun this is the place you want to stop.  It is well laid out and has lots of cool history.

data.title: Childhood Memories
data.text: What male wouldn't like this place?  It's full of all the Daisy BB guns ever made.  You can take all the time you want to read the displays and at the end they have a very nice gift shop where you can buy different model guns and limited edition guns.  A great place to take your young boys if they want a BB gun.  Oh, they also have pink BB guns available for the girls!

data.title: Fun family outing
data.text: We saw a display of Daisy guns ranging from early 1900's to the present.  Incredible.  Including the first Daisy BB gun ever made.  Very interesting.

data.title: mthjjr
data.text: Do not miss this. Every type of powder less gun ever made is there. I was amazed to see bellows powered rifle! Great history. Do not miss this one

data.title: Interesting visit & friendly staff
data.text: We were surprised to see all the teenagers and children visiting and that they actually seemed interested in the displays.  The museum offers headphones but they have a small number available and we were not able to listen to the audio.  My husband has fond memories of his Daisy and bought one for old times sake.  The staff were very friendly and wrapped the purchases for traveling.  However, the check out line was very long and the customer at the front of the line took well over 20 minutes from the time we joined the line.  The lady ahead of us had two small children and finally left.  It was obvious she was disappointed not to make her purchase.  It would have been nice if they'd had an "express" lane for customers such as that lady.  This is a small museum.  The check-out lane stretched in front of the "store" shelves and it was extremely difficult to see their offerings.  Their web site seems to be rarely updated.  There was nothing to indicate whether or not they would be open on July 4 on the site.  They were not.  For someone interested in the history and mystique of Daisy airguns this is the place to visit.

data.title: RedRider
data.text: Got  a Daisy Red Rider for Christmas.  Went hunting and shot a Sparrow.  So upset in seeing it's red blood in snow that I  ever hunted again.  Nice museum to bring back childhood memories.

data.title: Great Nostalgia Museum
data.text: If you had a BB gun growing up, go here.  You will not believe the varied and extensive history of this place.  Nice building in nice downtown location.  Donations accepted.

data.title: Pleasant surprise
data.text: This wasn't high on my list of things to do but my twenty-something nephew had it as a priority. Small but surprisingly interesting. Doesn't take long unless you're a real airgun fan and worth the time.

data.title: Cool!
data.text: Small museum packed full of history. Self guided audio tour.  Love the Christmas Story display. Great place to visit.

data.title: A must see
data.text: If you are ever in Rogers, AR, head downtown to the Daisy Museum. For a guy like me, it's like stepping into my youth.  Don't miss it!

data.title: Small but packed with neat stuff!
data.text: Lots of neat Daisy memoribilia.  I did expect it to be a little larger than it was though. It gets a little bottled up with everyone trying to shop in the gift shop and come out of the museum at the same location.   But for $2 it was still nice for a quick stop in!  Little boys (and big ones too!) will love it!!

data.title: Anyone who loved their BB gun
data.text: History of air guns as well as history of Daisy.  Interesting facts to be found here related to NASA and the Navy.  Includes a shop for Daisy products.

data.title: Reliving Youth
data.text:
You get to walk through and pay a 2 fee on leaving but worth every penny. The amazing history that Daisy has not only in Airgun but other points of history. 

There is a small audio device you get when you go in and can listen to more about each area.

data.title: A Real Surprise in a Tiny Museum
data.text: This was probably the only museum where we paid a "fee", but given that you get a cool souvenir for that $2, it can't be beat.  I think almost everyone has or remembers BB guns, but I'll bet they don't know the half of what the Daisy company did and does.  It was a very nice spot

data.title: Pleasantly surprised - loved it!
data.text: A $2 audio tour was totally unexpected and very well done. Wonderful displays and lots of options for purchasing the air rifles.
